fields.name: Home
fields.content:
The Shadow looms on the horizon.

Know this – this shall be a convention of darkness and horror. There shall be live-action role-play opportunities and table-top RPGs throughout the weekend. The commonality between them is that all games are to be dark, intense, and character driven. There will likely be a primary LARP that takes up much of Saturday, and lesser activities well into the mornings.

Any of you with the courage to face this darkness, please step forward.

fields.name: Directions
fields.content:
Directions

Location: {{location}}

From Walnut Creek:
I-680 N toward Sacramento.
Toll road.
Follow I-680 N and I-780 W. Merge onto I-80 E.
Take the Springs Rd/Solano Ave exit from I-80 E.
Merge onto Florida St (go straight at the stop sign)
Turn left onto Miller Ave.
Take the 1st right onto Springs Rd at the light.
Destination will be on the left.

From Richmond/ San Francisco:
Take I-80 East.
Toll road.
Take the Springs Rd/Solano Ave exit from I-80 E.
Merge onto Florida St (go straight at the stop sign)
Turn left onto Miller Ave.
Take the 1st right onto Springs Rd at the light.
Destination will be on the left.

From Sacramento:
Take I-80 West.
Take the exit toward Solano Ave/Springs Rd.
Turn right onto Solano Ave.
Continue onto Springs Rd.
Destination will be on the left.

Public Transportation:

**NOTE – SolTrans buses take exact change, AND are now set up for Clipper**

From Walnut Creek BART:
Take the Soltrans route-78 bus northbound to the Vallejo Transit Center.
http://www.soltransride.com/routes/multizone-mapschedule/route-78/
From the Vallejo Transit Center, take the Soltrans route-7 bus to Springs Rd.
http://www.soltransride.com/routes/route-mapsschedules/route-7/
Get off at the bus stop AT the Red Onion. Walk across the street.

From Richmond/San Francisco:
Take BART to the El Cerrito Del Norte BART station.
Take the Soltrans route-80 bus eastbound to the Vallejo Transit Center.
http://www.soltransride.com/routes/multizone-mapschedule/route-80/
From the Vallejo Transit Center, take the Soltrans route-7 bus to Springs Rd.
http://www.soltransride.com/routes/route-mapsschedules/route-7/
Get off at the bus stop AT the Red Onion. Walk across the street.

From Sacramento:
**Please note: This bus route does not run on Sunday!**
Take the FAST Transit route-30 bus
http://www.fasttransit.org/schedules-maps/express-intercity-route-maps-and-schedules/route-30/
Get off at the Solano Town Center (aka Westfield Solano mall).
Take the Soltrans route-85 bus westbound to the Vallejo Transit Center.
http://www.soltransride.com/routes/multizone-mapschedule/route-76/
From the Vallejo Transit Center, take the Soltrans route-7 bus to Springs Rd.
http://www.soltransride.com/routes/route-mapsschedules/route-7/
Get off at the bus stop AT the Red Onion. Walk across the street.

fields.name: Site Rules
fields.content:
Site Rules:

Onsite Rules:

  • All doors must remain closed at all times. Unless immediately attended, no doors can even be propped open. If you want to get in, you can ring the bell at the front door of the office, you can knock on the window next to the back door and hope someone hears you, or you can call someone you know who will be there.
  • If there is a problem with anything about the site, notify a ShadowCon coordinator (Christina, Morgan, Brittany, or Erin) immediately. Some examples of this include: if there is a spill, toilet paper runs out, toilet overflow, heater or AC needed or kitchen malfunction.
  • You are responsible for your own mess. Clean up after yourself and leave any space that you were in, in the same condition or better.
  • GM’s: you are in charge of making sure that the room you used for your game is clean. Make sure to check for any cups, food, stuff on the floor, etc. If you used any computers or other electronics, be sure to turn them off again before you leave the room.
  • If you are leaving the building after dark, use the buddy system and let others know that you are leaving.
  • No sex on site.

fields.name: Site Amenities
fields.content:
Amenities:

  • Large Men’s and Women’s bathrooms with multiple stalls. No showers available onsite.
  • There is a fully functional kitchen! Microwaves, stove top, oven, refrigerator (the black one is for our use), sink and dishwasher. The kitchen is a shared space and must be cleaned up after every use.
  • For those caffeine fiends, there is a Keurig brewer (provide your own Keurig K-cups), and there is a large coffee brewer that can fill one of those large coffee pots (makes 8-10 cups of coffee) that costs $10/pot. There is also instant hot water for those tea lovers out there.
  • Central Heat and AC.
  • Free WiFi!
  • There should be plenty of parking onsite. There are a number of parking spaces in our private lot, and there is lots of street parking. Do not park in any of the spaces marked as Century 21. They are the office next door at 1300, and we would like to keep good relations with our neighbors.

Please note: the building is not in the greatest of Neighborhoods so please do not leave any valuables in your vehicles! The office will have plenty of places that you can keep your things.

Next up, I would like to say that for those of you who like to economize in travel, the site will be open for people who want to sleep over.
